Description: SUPER SALE. Price Dropped $100 . Was $1695, Now On Sale for $1595. VINTAGE GUITAR GARDEN presents a sweet USA made Vintage 1975 GIBSON SG Standard electric guitar. Features of this Medium RELIC 1975 Gibson SG Standard include:Mahogany SG Body finished in a Heritage Cherry Red with a black 3 ply pickguard Medium C profile mahogany neck with a rosewood fretboard, jumbo frets & 1 9/16" nut widthWhite fret edge binding along neck edges & moustache Gibson headstock profile 2 Gibson Humbucker pickups (original Tar Back Gibson Humbuckers) Gibson Harmonica style bridge & Gibson tuners 2 volume, 2 tone , 3 way selector switch. Comes with USA TKL SG molded hardcase Weighs 7.4 lbs   Here is a sweet vintage USA made 1975 Gibson SG Standard for Sale. See above for all its features. This one is unmolested and No HEADSTOCK REPAIR. The real deal , an American made Vintage Gibson SG Standard as made famous by players like: Angus Young, Tony Iommi, Frank Marino and so many other greats. Plays great with low action. A sweet medium C profile neck and jumbo frets (low & wide). Plug her into your favorite tube amp and she roars to life with that classic Gibson FAT Humbucker Tone! Unlike so many other vintage Gibson SG's out there, this one is all original except its 4 black plastic control knobs were replaced. Original Pots stamped '75. She sports 2 Tar-Back Gibson humbuckers, Gibson stamped tuners and the cool harmonica style bridge . USA Serial number # 152***. This SG Standard is 44 years old and has that MEDIUM RELIC look and feel. Great guitars are meant to be played and this one has been played. Years of natural play wear on the body and neck with nicks/dings/scratches. There is chrome tarnish on the bridge and tailpiece. The mahogany neck is straight & has approx 70% fret life left on its jumbo low wide frets (some light fret pitting) and subtle indents in the rosewood fretboard from years of string bending. As far as the body & neck finish , give it a good polish buffing and it will bring out the beautiful Heritage Cherry Red Finish . Overall condition is a Medium Relic ( condition 7.8 on 10 for being a 44 years old vintage instrument) . A Real Relic that sounds as good as it looks. And very importantly, NO HEADSTOCK BREAK which is the "KISS of DEATH" for the Value of any guitar. Ships with its TKL SG black hardcase (case is a 7.5 on 10).$100 PRICE DROP.
